questions.description: If current through a conductor at any instant is i = 2t +3t², then what is the charge transferred between t = 0 to t = 3s ?
When there is an electric current throught a conducting wire along its length, then an electric field must exist :

options.description: outside the wire but parallel to it
outside the wire but perpendicular to it
inside the wire but parallel to it
inside the wire but perpendicular to it

questions.description: The path of free electrons between two successive collision (with the positive ions of the metal) in a current carrying conductor is :

Assertion : Electric field outside the conducting wire which carries a constant current is zero.
Reason : Net charge on conducting current carrying wire is zero.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: A potential difference is applied across the ends of a metallic wire. If the potential difference is doubled, the drift velocity :

Assertion : Drift velocity of electron is proportional to electric field.
Reason : Mobility of free electron independent electric field.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description:
Assertion : In a wire of non-uniform cross-section, the current is the same every where.
Reason : The current in a wire is due to drift of electrons along the wire.

options.description: Both Assertion and Reason are true and Reason is correct explanation of Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are true but Reason is not correct explanation of Assertion.
Assertion is true and Reason is wrong.
Both Assertion and Reason are wrong.

questions.description: A steady current flows in a metallic conductor of non-uniform cross-section. Which of the following quantities remain constant along the length of the conductor :
Temperature of Cu wire increases then out of the following parameters, which one is decreases :
The product of resistivity and conductivity of a conductor :

options.description: remains unchange with variation in temperature

questions.description: Two wires of the  same meterial but of different diameters carry the same current i. If the ratio of their diameters is 2 : 1, then the corresponding ratio of their mean drift velocities will be :
A conducting wire is stretched such that its length is increased by 1%. Then change in its resistance is :
The resistance of a metallic wire becomes 8 times when :

questions.description: The electric resistance of a certain wire of iron is R. If its length and radius both are doubled then the resistance :

options.description: Will be doubled and the specific resistance will be halved
Will be halved and the specific resistance will remain unchanged
Will be halved and the specific resistance will be doubled
And the specific resistance, both will remain unchanged
